meanings.definition: Rehabbers (noun): Individuals or companies that renovate or restore properties for resale.
meanings.sent1: The rehabbers worked hard to fix up the old house.
meanings.sent2: Many rehabbers buy old buildings and make them beautiful again.
meanings.sent3: The rehabbers turned the rundown property into a stunning home.
meanings.sent4: The rehabbers were like artists, transforming the house into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The neighborhood was amazed by the magic the rehabbers worked on the house.

meanings.definition: Rehabbers (verb): To engage in the process of renovating or restoring properties for resale.
meanings.sent1: She rehabbers old houses to make them new again.
meanings.sent2: We will need to rehabbers the entire building before selling it.
meanings.sent3: He loves to rehabbers old furniture as a hobby.
meanings.sent4: The team will rehabbers the office space to attract buyers.
meanings.sent5: They plan to rehabbers the property and make a profit from it.
